Articles.Content:
After installing some mods I think I accidently messed up my textures. I got rid of the mods to make sure it wasn't the mods causing issues, and also I verified the game files in steam. Neither worked. Is there any way to get the textures back without reinstalling the game? The textures that are missing are the ground textures when viewing the facilitys for example (its just black) and also the textures of some of the space suits and other things on the menu screen are just black.

Edited May 18, 2017 by matthewlet

Did you delete the Squad folder in the Gamedata folder? 
Also, I think the fastest way to get everything back is to reinstall the game via steam.. Just make sure that you manually clear all the files you've put in by yourself.

If you're on steam, right click on Kerbal Space Program in your Games list and select Properties, then click Verify Integrity of Game Files.  That will check and redownload any missing or bad stock files without having to reinstall the whole game.

2 hours ago, Capt. Hunt said:

If you're on steam, right click on Kerbal Space Program in your Games list and select Properties, then click Verify Integrity of Game Files.  That will check and redownload any missing or bad stock files without having to reinstall the whole game.

Already did.

2 hours ago, DrLicor said:

Did you delete the Squad folder in the Gamedata folder? 
Also, I think the fastest way to get everything back is to reinstall the game via steam.. Just make sure that you manually clear all the files you've put in by yourself.

I didn't delete the squad folder. I just decided to do a reinstall, and its fine now. Thank you both for your help!
